result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R Reiter

defendant.name: Reiter, Michael R
defendant.address: S78 W18473 Lions Park Dr 6, Muskego, WI 53150

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order for Withdrawal of Counsel, filed by Atty Barnes

8:45 AM Defendant Michael R Reiter in court.  Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Michael R Reiter.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Barnes asked for a short adjournment in the defendant's felony matter. The Court will adjourn this matter and have it tag along with the defendant's other case. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:07 PM Defendant Michael R Reiter in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. 
Defendant states has not been provided counsel.  Atty. Herbers states the defendant did not want the public defender to represent him.  Defendant does not feel that he will get a fair trial and wants an attorney the will represent him at the best of their ability.  Atty. Herbers states he will get the defendant on the list to be appointed counsel as soon as possible.
Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:27 AM Defendant Michael R Reiter in court.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Michael R Reiter.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty. Miller moves to withdraw as counsel, new counsel will be appointed by the public defender's office. 
State does not object.
Court grants the motion to withdraw, time limits previously waived.
Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no disorderly conduct with Village of Mukwonago Police Department listed in the Criminal Complaint.

8:53 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.   Defendant Michael R Reiter in court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 10:15 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
